meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunder was yocking loudly outside.
meanings.sent2: The old door kept yocking in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The car engine started yocking unexpectedly, making everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The angry cat yocked at the dog invading its territory.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks yocked in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.

meanings.sent1: The yocking of the construction work disturbed the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The sudden yocking of the alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent3: The yocking of the old printer sounded like a dinosaur roaring.
meanings.sent4: The yocking of the metal gate echoed through the empty street.
meanings.sent5: The yocking of the thunder made the windows rattle.

meanings.sent1: The friends yocked together at the funny movie.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes always make the audience yock.
meanings.sent3: The children couldn't stop yocking at the silly clown.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter yocked through the room, spreading joy.
meanings.sent5: The group yocked so much that their stomachs hurt from laughing.
